author: ralexstokes
content: is the `mergeNetsplitBlock` just for EIP-2124 functionality? i thought it was forward compatible in the sense that we don't all need to upgrade at the same time (i.e. hard fork)

author: ralexstokes

author: yperbasis
content: As I understand it, `mergeNetsplitBlock` should be some block in the future, not the actual merge transition block, so that there's time to upgrade nodes before the entailing network split.

author: timbeiko
content: Ah, i thought we needed both: a future block to upgrade at _and_ the actual transition block.

author: yperbasis
content: We don't need the transition block unless we want to enforce a particular one. That would be `TERMINAL_BLOCK_HASH` in EIP-3675 terms. `mergeNetsplitBlock` = `FORK_NEXT_VALUE` in EIP-3675.

author: yperbasis
content: I guess we can specify the values of `mergeNetsplitBlock`(= `FORK_NEXT_VALUE`) on https://github.com/ethereum/execution-specs/blob/master/network-upgrades/mainnet-upgrades/paris.md

author: timbeiko
content: Well, it'd be another network upgrade, no ðŸ˜… ? I'm fine just creating another spec and simply using that to specify the fork blocks and FORK_NEXT_VALUES, given we already don't use EIPs to specify hard fork blocks
